articles.description: Museum of Natural and Cultural History Outreach Educator Kali Bissanti began her presentation Tuesday in Roseburg by asking children gathered if they could live on other planets besides the earth.
articles.title: Roseburg children learn their power in keeping the planet

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: OREGON — The Oregon Heritage Commission offers grants for qualified projects for the conservation, development and interpretation of Oregon's cultural heritage. Awards typically range between $3,000 and $20,000, and the grant application deadline is Oct. 2.
articles.title: Oregon Heritage Commission offers grants

articles.author: Amelia Winkelman The News-Review
articles.description: To get outdoors and open Zumba classes up to the public, the YMCA’s Wednesday evening class moves to Stewart Park during the summer.
articles.title: Heat up summer with Zumba in the Park

articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: August 8, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: 66 years ago today, the Roseburg Blast devastated downtown Roseburg, Oregon. The 1959 explosion destroyed city blocks, claimed lives, and forever changed the community, leaving a legacy of resilience and remembrance that endures each August 7th.
articles.title: Remembering the Roseburg Blast: August 7, 1959

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: August 7, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A California man was killed early Thursday when his bicycle was struck by a pickup on I-5 near Sutherlin. The crash closed the highway for about four hours. The driver had minor injuries, while a passenger was hospitalized with minor injuries, according to Oregon State Police.
articles.title: Bicyclist Killed in Early Morning Collision on I-5 Near Sutherlin

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Douglas Forest Protective Association has raised the fire danger to EXTREME across the Douglas District, effective August 10. New restrictions ban activities like using power saws, mowing dry grass, and metal work on private property until further notice.
articles.title: Fire Danger Raised to Extreme Across Douglas District: Public Restrictions Increase

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Emergency crews responded to two river rescues along the North Umpqua Saturday. A Myrtle Creek woman was rescued after being swept downstream, while a separate incident near milepost 24.5 resulted in the drowning death of 50-year-old Jonathon Vasquez of Mapleton.
articles.title: Idleyld Park river rescues: one life saved, one lost in swift currents

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: ROSEBURG, Ore. - For those seeking respite from the forecasted summer heat, Roseburg's popular splash pad at Fir Grove Park remains open daily until Labor Day.
articles.title: Fir Grove Park splash pad in Roseburg open until Labor Day for summer heat relief

articles.author: Ryan Bonham
articles.description: A 42-year-old California man died early Thursday morning after being struck by a vehicle on his bicycle on Interstate 5 near Sutherlin, according to the Oregon State Police.
articles.title: Bicyclist struck and killed by vehicle in Douglas County crash
